Authors:
Soledad Sacristan, Elena Garcia, Angela Alonso, Gonzalo
Platas
Title: THE ENDOPHYTIC MICOBIOTA OF ARABIDOPSIS THALIANA
Abstract:
Fungal endophytes are receiving increasing attention as
resources to for improve crop production and ecosystem management.
However, Tthe biology of these symbionts remains poorly characterized
due to a lack of model systems for a more efficient research. In this
work, we have analyzed the culturable endophytic mycobiota associated to
leaves and siliques of the model plant A. thaliana. We have studied the
effect of biotic and abiotic factors in the frequency of isolation of
fungal endophytes in plant specimens and in the species composition of
the endophytic community.The diversity of the endophytic assemblages of
natural occurring A. thaliana populations was high, and precipitation
and temperature were the two main factors determining the diversity and
species composition of the communities. This is, to our knowledge, the
first systematic isolation and study of the endophytic mycobiota of A.
thaliana. We propose A. thaliana and its endophytes as a model system
for an integral approach to the principles governing the endophytic
lifestyle, taking advantage of the molecular tools and the abundant
knowledge accessible from the host plant.
